intro: Tetrapterys lalandiana, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree with simple, alternate, and ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round, and fleshy drupe with a sweet, aromatic pulp. The botanical features of Tetrapterys lalandiana make it an attractive ornamental plant and a source of edible fruit in its native habitat.
